template.name: FortiGate by SNMP
template.description:
The template for monitoring FortiGate firewall by SNMP.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB FORTINET-CORE-MIB SNMPv2-MIB IF-MIB
Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

item.name: HA config sync
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Configuration of an automatic configuration synchronization (enabled or disabled).

item.name: HA cluster group ID
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB HA cluster group ID device is configured for.

item.name: HA cluster group name
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB HA cluster group name.

item.name: HA cluster primary override
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Status of the primary override flag.

item.name: HA cluster priority
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB HA clustering priority of the device (default = 128).

item.name: SNMP walk HA members
item.description: Used for discovering HA members from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: HA mode
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB High-availability mode (Standalone, A-A or A-P).

item.name: HA load-balancing schedule
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Load-balancing schedule of cluster (in A-A mode).

item.name: SNMP walk hardware sensors
item.description: Used for discovering hardware sensors from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: ICMP ping
item.description: Host accessibility by ICMP. 0 - ICMP ping failed. 1 - ICMP ping successful.

trigger.name: FortiGate: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

item.name: ICMP loss
item.description: Percentage of lost packets.

trigger.expression: min(/FortiGate by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/FortiGate by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: FortiGate: High ICMP ping loss

item.name: ICMP response time
item.description: ICMP ping response time (in seconds).

trigger.name: FortiGate: High ICMP ping response time
trigger.description: Average ICMP response time is too high.

dependency.name: FortiGate: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/FortiGate by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/FortiGate by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: Blocked intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of intrusions blocked per second.

item.name: IPS database version
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB IPS signature database version installed on the device.

item.name: Detected anomaly based intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of intrusions detected as anomalies per second.

item.name: Detected critical intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of critical severity intrusions detected per second.

item.name: Detected high intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of high severity intrusions detected per second.

item.name: Detected info intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of info severity intrusions detected per second.

item.name: Detected low intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of low severity intrusions detected per second.

item.name: Detected medium intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of medium severity intrusions detected per second.

item.name: Detected signature based intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of intrusions detected by signature per second.

item.name: Total detected intrusions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Total number of intrusions detected per second.

item.name: SNMP walk network interfaces
item.description: Used for discovering interfaces from IF-MIB.

item.name: IPv4 Active sessions
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of active sessions on the device.

item.name: SNMP walk SD-WAN health-checks
item.description: Used for discovering SD-WAN health-checks from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Used for collecting all SNMP traps unmatched by other `snmptrap` items.

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Name and contact information of the contact person for the node. If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: Number of CPUs
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of processors.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB CPU utilization in %.

trigger.name: FortiGate: High CPU utilization
trigger.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: SNMP walk CPU
item.description: Used for discovering CPU from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating system, and networking software.

item.name: Firmware version
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Firmware version of the device.

item.name: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB Model of the device.

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB Serial number of the device.

trigger.expression: last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: FortiGate: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: FortiGate: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Physical location of the node (e.g., `equipment room`, `3rd floor`). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for the node (the node's fully-qualified domain name). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/FortiGate by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: FortiGate: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: FortiGate: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the entity as part of the vendor's SMI enterprises subtree with the prefix 1.3.6.1.4.1 (e.g., a vendor with the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242 might assign a system object with the OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1).

item.name: System uptime
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: SNMP walk virtual domain
item.description: Used for discovering virtual domains from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: Free disk space
item.description: Free hard disk capacity.

item.name: Free disk percentage
item.description: Free disk space, expressed in %.

trigger.name: FortiGate: Free disk space is low
trigger.event_name: FortiGate: Free disk space is less than {$DISK.FREE.WARN}%
trigger.description: Available disk space is not enough.

dependency.name: FortiGate: Free disk space is too low

trigger.name: FortiGate: Free disk space is too low
trigger.event_name: FortiGate: Free disk space is less than {$DISK.FREE.CRIT}%
trigger.description: Available disk space is too low.

item.name: Total disk space
item.description: Total hard disk capacity.

item.name: Used disk space
item.description: Current hard disk usage.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Total memory available for utilization.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Total physical memory (RAM) installed.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Physical memory (RAM) used calculated based on memory utilization percentage.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Current memory utilization (percentage).

trigger.name: FortiGate: High memory utilization
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: SSL VPN state
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Used to determine whether SSL-VPN is enabled on this virtual domain.

item.name: Active IPsec VPN tunnels
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of IPsec VPN tunnels with at least one SA.

item.name: SNMP walk VPN tunnels
item.description: Used for discovering VPN tunnels from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: Active SSL VPN users
item.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Current number of users logged in through SSL-VPN tunnels in the virtual domain.

item.name: SNMP walk wireless AP
item.description: Used for discovering wireless access points from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible values: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: FortiGate: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering CPUs from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: Average system usage over 1min
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The processor's CPU system space usage, expressed as an average calculated over the last minute. (Only valid for processor types that support this statistic.)

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: Average usage over 1min
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The processor's CPU usage in %, expressed as an average calculated over the last minute. (Only valid for processor types that support this statistic.)

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: Average user usage over 1min
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The processor's CPU user space usage, expressed as an average calculated over the last minute. (Only valid for processor types that support this statistic.)

graph_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: Average usage per core

discovery_rule.name: HA member discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering HA members from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Anti-virus events
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of anti-virus events triggered on the specified cluster member per second.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Bytes processed
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of bytes processed by the specified cluster member per second.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Global checksum
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Current HA global checksum value.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: CPU usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB CPU usage of the specified cluster member (percentage).

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Hostname
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Host name of the specified cluster member.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: IPS events
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of IDS/IPS events triggered on the specified cluster member per second.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Memory usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Memory usage of the specified cluster member (percentage).

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Network bandwidth usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Network bandwidth usage of the specified cluster member (bps).

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Packets processed
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of packets processed by the specified cluster member per second.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Primary serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Serial number of the primary HA member during the last sync attempt (successful or not).

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Serial number of the HA cluster member.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Session count
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Current session count of the specified cluster member.

item_prototype.name: HA {#HA.ID}: Sync status
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Current HA sync status.

discovery_rule.name: Hardware sensors discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering hardware sensors from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: Sensor {#SENSOR.NAME}: Alarm status
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB If the sensor has an alarm threshold and has exceeded it, this will indicate its status. Not all sensors have alarms.

item_prototype.name: Sensor {#SENSOR.NAME}: Value
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB A string representation of the value of the sensor. Because sensors can present data in different formats, string representation is the most general format. Interpretation of the value (units of measure, for example) is dependent on the individual sensor.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering interfaces from IF-MIB.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces - the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces - the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of `ifInOctets`. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces - the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces - the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of `ifOutOctets`. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n`, then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000` to `n+499,999`. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The `testing(3)` state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. - If `ifAdminStatus` is `down(2)`, then `ifOperStatus` should be `down(2)`. - If `ifAdminStatus` is changed to `up(1)`, then `ifOperStatus` should change to `up(1)` if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic. - It should change to `dormant(5)` if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection). - It should remain in the `down(2)` state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the `up(1)` state. - It should remain in the `notPresent(6)` state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the operations status is down. 2. `{$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. `{TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1` - the trigger fires only if the operational status was up to "1" sometime before.
WARNING: if closed manually - it will not fire again on the next poll, because of `.diff`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for `ifType` are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The trigger recovers when it is below 80% of the `{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}` threshold.

dependency.name: FortiGate: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

discovery_rule.name: SD-WAN health-check discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering SD-WAN health-check from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Jitter
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The average jitter of a health check on a specific member link in a float number within the last 30 probes.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Latency
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The average latency of a health check on a specific member link in a float number within the last 30 probes.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Packets loss
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The packet loss percentage of a health check on a specific member link in a float number within the last 30 probes.

trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: High packets loss
trigger_prototype.description: High level of packet loss detected.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Packets received per second
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of packets received by a health check on a specific member link per second.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Packets sent per second
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of packets sent by a health check on a specific member link per second.

item_prototype.name: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Health check state
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Health check state on a specific member link.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$SDWAN.HEALTH.IF.CONTROL:"{#HNAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/sdwan_health.state[fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=1 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/sdwan_health.state[fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/sdwan_health.state[fgVWLHealthCheckLinkState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: SD-WAN [{#HNAME}]:[{#IFNAME}]: Health check state is dead
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the health check state is dead. 2. `{$SDWAN.HEALTH.IF.CONTROL:"{#HNAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this health check as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this health check is dead. 3. `{TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1` - the trigger fires only if the health check state was up to "1" sometime before.
WARNING: If closed manually, it will not fire again on the next poll because of `diff`.

discovery_rule.name: SoC3 discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering SoC3 NP6Lite processors from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: SoC3 {#CPU.ID}: Packets dropped
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The total number of packets dropped by this processor (only valid for processor types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SoC3 {#CPU.ID}: Packets received
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The total number of packets received by this processor (only valid for processor types that support this statistic).

item_prototype.name: SoC3 {#CPU.ID}: Packets transmitted
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The total number of packets transmitted by this processor (only valid for processor types that support this statistic).

discovery_rule.name: Virtual domain discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering virtual domains from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: CPU usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB CPU usage of the virtual domain (percentage).

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: HA member state
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB HA cluster member state of the virtual domain on this device.

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: Memory usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Memory usage of the virtual domain (percentage).

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: Operation mode
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Operation mode of the virtual domain (NAT or Transparent).

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: Sessions rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB The session setup rate on the virtual domain per second.

item_prototype.name: VDOM {#VDOM.NAME}: Active sessions
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Number of active sessions on the virtual domain.

discovery_rule.name: VPN tunnel discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering VPN tunnels from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Current status of tunnel (up or down).

trigger_prototype.expression: {$VPN.STATE.CONTROL:"{#VPN.NAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/vpn.tunnel.status[fgVpnTunEntStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=1 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/vpn.tunnel.status[fgVpnTunEntStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/vpn.tunnel.status[fgVpnTunEntStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the current tunnel state is down. 2. `{$VPN.STATE.CONTROL}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this notification as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this tunnel is down.

discovery_rule.name: Wireless discovery
discovery_rule.description: Used for discovering wireless access points from FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Administrative status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the administrative status of this wireless termination point (WTP).
The following enumerated values are supported: `discovered(1)` - This WTP was discovered though discovery or join request messages. `disable(2)` - Controller is configured to not provide service to this WTP. `enable(3)` - Controller is configured to provide service to this WTP. `other(0)` - The administration state of the WTP is unknown.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Background scan
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Whether background scan is enabled on this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Base MAC Address
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the WTP's Base MAC Address, which MAY be assigned to the primary Ethernet interface. The instance of the object corresponds to the Base MAC Address sub-element in the CAPWAP protocol [RFC5415].

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Bootloader version
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the boot loader version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Connected clients
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the number of clients currently connected to this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Connection status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the connection status of a WTP to the AC.
The following enumerated values are supported: `offLine(1)` - The WTP is not connected. `onLine(2)` - The WTP is connected. `downloadingImage(3)` - The WTP is downloading software image from the AC on joining. `connectedImage(4)` - The AC is pushing a software image to the connected WTP. `other(0)` - The WTP connection status is unknown.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$WC.STATE.CONTROL:"{#WC.NAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=1 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Connection is down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the current connection status is `offLine`. 2. `{$WC.STATE.CONTROL}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this notification as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this connection is down.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$WC.UPDATE.CONTROL:"{#WC.NAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=3 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Receiving firmware update
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the current connection status is `downloadingImage`. 2. `{$WC.UPDATE.CONTROL}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this notification as not important. No new trigger will be fired if the status is `downloadingImage`.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$WC.UPDATE.CONTROL:"{#WC.NAME}"}=1 and last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=4 and (last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/FortiGate by SNMP/wc.conn.status[fgWcWtpSessionConnectionState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Sending firmware update
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the current connection status is `connectedImage`. 2. `{$WC.UPDATE.CONTROL}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this notification as not important. No new trigger will be fired if the status is `connectedImage`.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: CPU usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the current CPU usage of a WTP (percentage).

trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.event_name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: High CPU utilization (over {$WC.CPU.UTIL.CRIT:"{#WC.NAME}"}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The CPU utilization is too high.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Daemon uptime
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the time since the WTP daemon has been started.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Hardware version
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the hardware version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: IP Address
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the IP address of a WTP that corresponds to the IP address in the IP packet header.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: IP Address type
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the IP address type of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Local IP Address
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the local IP address of a WTP and models the CAPWAP Local IPv4 Address or CAPWAP Local IPv6 Address fields [RFC5415]. If a Network Address Translation (NAT) device is present between the WTP and access controller (AC), the value of `fgWcWtpWtpLocalIpAddress` will be different from the value of `fgWcWtpWtpIpAddress`.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Local IP Address type
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the local IP address type of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Location
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the location of this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Memory capacity
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the total physical memory (RAM) installed.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Memory usage
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the current memory usage of a WTP (percentage).

trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: High memory utilization
trigger_prototype.event_name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: High memory utilization (>{$WC.MEMORY.UTIL.MAX:"{#WC.NAME}"}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The WTP is running out of free memory.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Model number
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the model number of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Profile name
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the profile configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio ATPC high limit
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the high limit of radio automatic TX power control configured for this WTP, in dBm.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio ATPC low limit
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the low limit of radio automatic TX power control configured for this WTP, in dBm.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio ATPC status
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Whether radio automatic TX power control is enabled on this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio band
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the radio band configured for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio enabled
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Whether radio is enabled for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Radio TX power level
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the radio TX power setting configured for this WTP, expressed in %.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the number of bits received by this WTP per second.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the number of bits transmitted by this WTP per second.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Region code
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the region code programmed for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Session uptime
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the time since the WTP has been connected to the AC.

trigger_prototype.name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Session has been restarted
trigger_prototype.event_name: FortiGate: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Session has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Software version
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the software version of a WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: Uptime
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents the time since the WTP has booted.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: All VAPs selected
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Whether all wireless virtual access points (VAP) are selected for this WTP.

item_prototype.name: WTP {#WC.NAME}: VAPs list
item_prototype.description: MIB: FORTINET-FORTIGATE-MIB Represents a list of wireless virtual access points (VAP) configured for this WTP.
